Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that NASA is prepping a 17-year-old to become the first human on Mars, when in fact NASA has no official connection to the mentioned teen.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a headline from a website called Scicademy, which is not an official source and has been contradicted by NASA.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that NASA is actively preparing the mentioned teenager for a trip to Mars, despite NASA denying any official ties.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that private groups are also considering the mentioned teenager for a space mission, as mentioned by her father in an article for Teen Vogue.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that NASA has no official connection to the mentioned teenager, as confirmed by NASA spokesperson Sean Potter.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided information.
